name: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente.
Fry pancetta in a pan until crispy.
Whisk eggs and mix with grated cheeses.
Drain pasta, reserve some water, and mix with pancetta.
Remove from heat, add egg mixture, and stir quickly.
Add pasta water if needed, season with black pepper.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry
description: Quick and healthy stir-fried vegetables with tofu in a savory sauce.
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a wok or pan.
Add garlic and ginger, stir for 30 seconds.
Add tofu and cook until golden.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Pour soy sauce and toss well.
Serve hot.

name: Greek Salad
description: Fresh and tangy salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese.
instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and olives in a bowl.
Add feta cheese on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle oregano.
Season with salt and toss gently.

name: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
description: Creamy vegan dessert made with avocado and dark chocolate.
instructions: Blend avocados until smooth.
Add melted chocolate, maple syrup, vanilla, and salt.
Blend again until creamy.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Creamy Indian curry with marinated grilled chicken in spiced tomato sauce.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spice mix for 1 hour.
Grill or bake chicken until cooked.
Sauté onion and garlic, add tomato puree, and simmer.
Add chicken and cream, cook for 10 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.

name: Margherita Pizza
description: Classic Italian pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil.
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out dough and spread tomato sauce.
Add sliced mozzarella.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden.
Top with fresh basil and drizzle with olive oil.

name: Beef Tacos
description: Traditional Mexican tacos with seasoned ground beef and fresh toppings.
instructions: Brown beef in a skillet, add seasoning.
Warm tortillas according to package.
Assemble tacos with beef and toppings.

name: Chicken Curry
description: Spicy Indian curry with tender chicken pieces in rich sauce.
instructions: Sauté onion, garlic and ginger in oil.
Add chicken and brown lightly.
Stir in curry powder and coconut milk.
Simmer for 20 minutes until chicken is cooked.

name: Vegetable Spring Rolls
description: Crispy Chinese appetizers filled with fresh vegetables.
instructions: Mix vegetables with soy sauce and sesame oil.
Wrap in spring roll wrappers.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown.

name: Miso Soup
description: Traditional Japanese soup with tofu and seaweed.
instructions: Heat stock to simmer.
Dissolve miso paste in stock.
Add tofu and seaweed.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with green onions.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
description: Healthy breakfast with yogurt, granola and fresh berries.
instructions: Layer yogurt, berries and granola in a glass.
Drizzle with honey.

name: Ratatouille
description: French vegetable stew with eggplant, zucchini and bell peppers.
instructions: Slice all vegetables thinly.
Layer in baking dish with oil and herbs.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes.

name: Hummus
description: Creamy Middle Eastern chickpea dip.
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
Drizzle with olive oil to serve.

name: Avocado Toast
description: Simple breakfast toast with mashed avocado.
instructions: Toast bread until golden.
Mash avocado with lemon juice.
Spread on toast and season.

name: Tabbouleh
description: Fresh Mediterranean salad with bulgur and herbs.
instructions: Soak bulgur in boiling water for 30 minutes.
Chop all vegetables and herbs finely.
Mix everything with oil and lemon juice.
Chill before serving.

name: Guacamole
description: A creamy and flavorful Mexican dip made with avocados.
instructions: Halve avocados, remove pits, and scoop the flesh into a bowl.
Mash the avocado with a fork to your desired consistency.
Stir in chopped red onion, minced pepper (if using), and cilantro.
Add lime juice and salt to taste. Mix well.
Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for later.

name: Beef Stir-Fry
description: A quick and easy Chinese stir-fry with tender beef and vegetables.
ingredients: Beef sirloin or flank steak, thinly sliced
Bell peppers (red, yellow, or green), sliced
instructions: In a bowl, toss beef slices with soy sauce and cornstarch. Let it marinate for 15 minutes.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add beef and stir-fry until browned.
Remove beef from the wok and set aside.
Add broccoli, bell peppers, and onion to the wok and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until slightly tender-crisp.
Stir in minced garlic and grated ginger and cook for 1 minute more.
Return the beef to the wok. Add oyster sauce (if using) and sesame oil. Stir well to combine.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

name: Classic Burger
description: A quintessential American burger with a juicy beef patty.
instructions: Gently form ground beef into patties. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or longer to your preference.
During the last minute of cooking, place cheese slices on top of the patties if desired.
Lightly toast the burger buns.
Assemble the burgers with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, ketchup, and mustard.

name: French Onion Soup
description: A rich and flavorful French soup with caramelized onions and a cheesy crouton topping.
instructions: Melt butter and olive oil in a large pot over medium-low heat. Add sliced onions and cook slowly, stirring occasionally, until deeply caramelized (about 30-40 minutes).
Add beef broth and white wine (if using) to the pot. Stir in bay leaf and thyme sprigs. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for another 15-20 minutes.
Preheat broiler. Place baguette slices on a baking sheet and toast lightly.
Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls. Place a toasted baguette slice on top of each bowl and sprinkle generously with Gruyère cheese.
Broil for 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from broiler and let cool slightly before serving.

name: Caprese Salad
description: A simple and elegant Italian salad with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil.
instructions: Arrange alternating slices of mozzarella and tomatoes on a platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the cheese and tomato slices.
Drizzle generously with extra virgin olive oil.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze if desired.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

name: Grilled Chicken Salad
description: A healthy and protein-rich salad with grilled chicken, fresh veggies, and a light dressing.
instructions: Season chicken breast with salt and pepper.
Grill the chicken until fully cooked.
Chop vegetables and place them in a bowl.
Slice the grilled chicken and add on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice before serving.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: Quick and easy stir-fried vegetables with a savory soy-based sauce.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan.
Add chopped garlic and onion, sauté until fragrant.
Add vegetables and stir-fry on high heat.
Add soy sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot with or without rice.

name: Lentil Soup
description: Warm and hearty soup made with lentils, vegetables, and spices.
instructions: Heat oil and sauté garlic, onion, celery, and carrots.
Add lentils, tomato paste, broth, and spices.
Bring to boil then simmer until lentils are tender.
Blend for a creamy texture or serve chunky.

name: Chickpea Curry
description: Spicy Indian-style curry made with chickpeas and tomatoes.
instructions: Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger in oil.
Add curry powder and stir until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and chickpeas, cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve with rice or flatbread.

name: Oatmeal with Banana
description: Warm oatmeal topped with sliced banana and nuts.
instructions: Cook oats in milk or water until soft.
Top with sliced banana and sprinkle cinnamon.
Add nuts for crunch.

name: Baked Salmon with Veggies
description: Oven-baked salmon served with a side of roasted vegetables.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place salmon and chopped veggies on a baking tray.
Drizzle with olive oil, lemon, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 20 minutes or until cooked through.

name: Hummus with Pita Bread
description: Classic hummus dip served with warm pita bread slices.
instructions: Blend chickpeas, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, and salt until smooth.
Serve in a bowl with a drizzle of olive oil.
Warm the pita bread and serve on the side.

name: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
description: Low-carb zucchini noodles tossed in a fresh basil pesto sauce.
instructions: Spiralize the zucchini to make noodles.
Blend basil, garlic, pine nuts, olive oil, and parmesan to make pesto.
Toss noodles with pesto and serve fresh or lightly sautéed.

name: Chicken Fajitas
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sliced chicken, bell peppers, and onion to the skillet.
Sprinkle with fajita seasoning and cook until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender-crisp.
Warm flour tortillas according to package directions.
Serve chicken and vegetable mixture in warm tortillas with salsa, guacamole, and sour cream.

name: Vegetable Biryani
description: A flavorful Indian mixed rice dish with vegetables and aromatic spices.
instructions: Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.
Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add sliced onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies and sauté for a minute.
Add mixed vegetables, biryani masala, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Stir in yogurt, chopped cilantro, and mint leaves.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot. Add enough water to cook the rice.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until rice is done.
Garnish with saffron milk before serving.

name: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
instructions: In a bowl, toss beef slices with soy sauce and cornstarch. Let it marinate for 15 minutes.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add beef and stir-fry until browned.
Add broccoli florets, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Stir-fry until broccoli is tender-crisp.
Stir in oyster sauce (if using) and sesame oil.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

name: Miso Soup with Tofu and Seaweed
instructions: Heat dashi stock in a saucepan until simmering.
In a small bowl, whisk a small amount of the hot dashi with the miso paste until dissolved.
Pour the miso mixture back into the saucepan and stir well. Do not boil.
Add cubed tofu and soaked wakame seaweed to the soup.
Simmer gently for a few minutes until heated through.
Garnish with thinly sliced green onions before serving.

name: Classic Hamburger
instructions: Gently form ground beef into patties and season with salt and pepper.
Preheat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook patties for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or to desired doneness.
Lightly toast hamburger buns.
Assemble hamburgers with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, ketchup, and mustard.

name: Tzatziki Sauce
description: A refreshing Greek yogurt-based sauce with cucumber and garlic.
instructions: Grate the cucumber and squeeze out excess liquid.
In a bowl, combine Greek yogurt, grated cucumber, minced garlic, and chopped dill.
Stir in lemon juice and a drizzle of olive oil.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.

name: Quinoa Tabbouleh
description: A fresh and light salad with quinoa, parsley, mint, and lemon.
instructions: Cook quinoa and let it cool.
Chop parsley, mint, tomatoes, and cucumber.
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Add lemon juice, olive oil, and salt.
Toss well and serve chilled.

name: Turkey Lettuce Wraps
description: Low-carb wraps made with ground turkey and crispy lettuce.
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
Add ground turkey and cook until browned.
Stir in soy sauce and shredded carrots.
Spoon into lettuce leaves and serve.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
description: Baked eggplant slices layered with tomato sauce and cheese.
instructions: Slice and bake eggplant with olive oil.
Layer with tomato sauce and cheeses.
Bake until golden and bubbly.
Top with fresh basil and serve.

name: Spicy Tuna Roll
description: Japanese-style sushi rolls with spicy tuna filling.
instructions: Mix chopped tuna with sriracha and mayo.
Spread rice on nori and add tuna filling.
Roll tightly and slice into pieces.
Serve with soy sauce.

name: Black Bean Tacos
description: Easy vegan tacos with seasoned black beans and fresh toppings.
instructions: Season and warm black beans.
Fill taco shells with beans, veggies, and avocado.
Top with lime juice and serve.

name: Avocado Chocolate Mousse
description: Creamy chocolate dessert made with ripe avocados.
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with a savory rice and veggie mix.
instructions: Cook rice and mix with beans, corn, and spices.
Stuff mixture into bell peppers.
Top with tomato sauce and bake until tender.

name: Chicken Fajita Bowl
description: Deconstructed fajitas served in a nutritious bowl.
instructions: Cook chicken with spices until browned.
Sauté peppers and onions.
Serve over brown rice with a squeeze of lime.

name: French Omelette
description: Classic fluffy omelette with herbs and cheese.
instructions: Whisk eggs and season.
Cook in butter and gently fold with cheese and herbs.
Serve hot.

name: Shakshuka
description: Poached eggs in a spiced tomato sauce.
instructions: Sauté onion, garlic, and pepper.
Add tomatoes and spices, simmer until thickened.
Crack eggs into sauce and poach until whites are set.
Serve with crusty bread.

name: Tofu Stir-Fry
description: Quick vegan stir-fry with tofu and mixed vegetables.
instructions: Pan-fry tofu until golden.
Sauté vegetables and add tofu back.
Add soy sauce, garlic, and ginger.
Serve hot.

name: Greek Chicken Skewers
description: Grilled chicken marinated in lemon and oregano.
instructions: Marinate chicken in lemon, garlic, oregano, and oil.
Thread onto skewers and grill until done.
Serve with salad or rice.

name: Chia Pudding
description: A healthy snack or breakfast made with chia seeds and plant milk.
instructions: Mix chia seeds, milk, vanilla, and syrup.
Refrigerate overnight until thick.
Top with fresh berries before serving.

name: Pasta Aglio e Olio
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over low heat.
Add sliced garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Cook gently until garlic is fragrant and lightly golden, about 3-5 minutes. Be careful not to burn the garlic.
Reserve about 1 cup of pasta water before draining the spaghetti.
Add the drained spaghetti to the skillet with the garlic and oil. Toss to combine.
Add some of the reserved pasta water to create a light sauce that coats the pasta.
Stir in chopped fresh parsley. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve immediately, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

name: Black Bean Salsa
ingredients: Canned black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine rinsed black beans, corn kernels, chopped red onion, and diced bell pepper.
Add minced jalapeño (if using) and chopped cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the black bean mixture and stir gently to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve as a dip with tortilla chips or as a topping for grilled chicken or fish.

name: Aloo Gobi (Potato and Cauliflower Curry)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a pot or pan. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Stir in chopped tomato and cook until softened.
Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for a minute.
Add cubed potatoes and cauliflower florets. Stir well to coat with the spices.
Add a little water, cover, and cook until potatoes and cauliflower are tender.
Stir in garam masala and chopped cilantro before serving hot with roti or rice.

name: Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Lightly beat the eggs in a bowl and set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble until cooked. Remove from the wok and set aside.
Add more vegetable oil to the wok. Add chopped onion and diced carrot and stir-fry for a few minutes until slightly softened.
Add peas and cooked rice to the wok. Break up any clumps of rice and stir-fry for a few minutes.
Stir in soy sauce and the cooked scrambled eggs.
Stir in chopped scallions and sesame oil (if using). Serve hot.

name: Edamame
instructions: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
Add edamame pods and cook for 3-5 minutes if fresh, or 5-7 minutes if frozen, until tender.
Drain the edamame and sprinkle with more salt if desired.
Serve warm as a snack or appetizer.

name: Baba Ghanoush
description: A smoky and creamy Mediterranean eggplant dip.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Prick the eggplant all over with a fork.
Roast the eggplant directly on the oven rack or on a baking sheet for 40-60 minutes, or until the skin is charred and the eggplant is very soft.
Let the eggplant cool slightly, then scoop out the flesh into a bowl.
Mash the eggplant flesh with a fork or blend in a food processor until smooth.
Stir in tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt. Mix well.
Transfer to a serving dish, drizzle with olive oil, and garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Serve with pita bread or vegetables.

name: BLT Sandwich
instructions: Toast bread slices to your desired crispness.
Spread mayonnaise on one or both slices of bread.
Layer cooked bacon, lettuce leaves, and tomato slices on one slice of bread.
Top with the other slice of bread. Cut in half and serve.

name: Fattoush Salad
description: A Levantine bread salad made with toasted or fried pita bread and mixed greens.
instructions: Cut pita bread into small pieces and either toast them in the oven until crispy or fry them in oil until golden brown. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, diced tomatoes, diced cucumbers, thinly sliced red onion, and diced bell pepper.
Add chopped fresh parsley and fresh mint.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, sumac, and salt.
Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to combine.
Just before serving, add the toasted or fried pita bread pieces and toss gently.

name: Soupe à l'oignon Gratinée
description: The classic French onion soup with a cheesy bread topping.
instructions: Melt butter and olive oil in a large pot over medium-low heat. Add onions and cook slowly, stirring occasionally, until deeply caramelized, about 30-40 minutes.
Add beef broth and white wine (if using), bay leaf, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes.
Preheat broiler. Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls. Top each bowl with a slice of crusty bread and sprinkle generously with grated Gruyère cheese.
Place the bowls under the broiler until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove bay leaf and thyme before serving.

name: Spanakopita (Spinach Pie)
description: A savory Greek pastry filled with spinach and feta cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
If using fresh spinach, sauté until wilted and drain well, squeezing out excess liquid. If using frozen, thaw and squeeze out excess liquid.
Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add chopped onion and scallions and sauté until softened.
In a large bowl, combine spinach, crumbled feta cheese, sautéed onion mixture, beaten eggs, and chopped dill and nutmeg (if using). Season with salt and pepper.
Brush a baking dish with olive oil.
Layer several sheets of phyllo dough in the dish, brushing each sheet with olive oil.
Spread the spinach and feta filling evenly over the phyllo dough.
Top with more layers of phyllo dough, brushing each sheet with olive oil.
Trim any excess dough and crimp the edges to seal. Brush the top with olive oil.
Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until golden brown and flaky.
Let cool slightly before serving.

name: Bruschetta with Tomatoes and Basil
instructions: Preheat oven or grill to medium heat.
Brush baguette slices with olive oil and toast or grill until lightly golden.
Rub the cut side of the garlic clove over the toasted bread.
In a bowl, combine diced tomatoes and chopped basil.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Spoon the tomato mixture over the toasted baguette slices. Serve immediately.

name: Quesadillas
instructions: Heat a lightly oiled skillet or griddle over medium heat.
Place one tortilla in the skillet and sprinkle with shredded cheese.
Add cooked chicken or other fillings if desired.
Place another tortilla on top of the cheese.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the tortilla is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Remove from skillet and cut into wedges. Serve with salsa, sour cream, or guacamole.

name: Chana Masala (Chickpea Curry)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a pot or pan. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Stir in diced tomatoes and cook until softened.
Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for a minute.
Add rinsed chickpeas and a little water. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the chickpeas are tender and the sauce has thickened.
Stir in garam masala and chopped cilantro before serving hot with rice or naan.

name: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: Douchi (fermented black beans), rinsed and chopped
instructions: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a simmer. Gently add tofu cubes and simmer for a few minutes to help them hold their shape. Drain carefully.
Heat oil in a wok or skillet over medium heat. Add ground pork or beef (if using) and stir-fry until browned.
Add doubanjiang and douchi and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add minced garlic and ginger and stir-fry for a few seconds.
Pour in chicken or vegetable broth and soy sauce. Bring to a simmer.
Gently add the drained tofu cubes to the wok.
In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water to make a slurry. Pour the slurry into the wok and stir gently until the sauce thickens.
Stir in Sichuan peppercorns. Garnish with chopped scallions and serve hot with rice.

name: Tempura Vegetables
ingredients: Assorted vegetables (broccoli florets, bell pepper strips, sweet potato slices, green beans)
instructions: Prepare the dipping sauce by combining soy sauce, dashi, and mirin to taste. Set aside.
Cut vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
In a bowl, whisk together tempura flour and ice water until just combined. Do not overmix; the batter should be thin and slightly lumpy.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
Dip each vegetable piece into the tempura batter, ensuring it is lightly coated.
Carefully drop the battered vegetables into the hot oil, working in batches to avoid overcrowding.
Fry for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Serve immediately with the prepared dipping sauce.

name: Tabbouleh Salad
description: A refreshing Mediterranean salad made primarily of finely chopped parsley, tomatoes, mint, onion, and bulgur, seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, and salt.
instructions: Soak bulgur wheat in hot water for 20-30 minutes, or until softened. Drain well, pressing out any excess water.
In a large bowl, combine soaked bulgur, finely chopped parsley, diced tomatoes, chopped mint, and chopped red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Serve chilled.

name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
instructions: Spread butter on one side of each bread slice.
Place one slice of bread, butter-side down, in a skillet over medium heat.
Place cheese slices on top of the bread.
Top with the other slice of bread, butter-side up.
Cook for 3-5 minutes per side, or until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is melted and gooey.

name: Kofta Kebabs
description: Spiced ground meat skewers, popular in Arabic cuisine.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground lamb or beef, grated onion (squeeze out excess liquid), chopped parsley, cumin, coriander, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Mix well until all ingredients are evenly combined.
Form the mixture into elongated shapes around skewers.
Preheat grill or oven to medium heat.
Grill or bake the kofta kebabs for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through and lightly browned, turning occasionally.
Serve hot with pita bread, rice, or salad.

name: Crêpes
description: Thin French pancakes that can be sweet or savory.
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together flour and salt (and sugar if making sweet crêpes).
In a separate bowl, whisk eggs and milk.
Gradually whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until a smooth batter forms.
Stir in melted butter.
Heat a lightly greased non-stick skillet or crêpe pan over medium heat.
Pour a thin layer of batter onto the hot pan, swirling to coat the bottom evenly.
Cook for 1-2 minutes per side, or until lightly golden.
Repeat with the remaining batter.
Fill with your desired sweet or savory fillings.

name: Avgolemono Soup
description: A classic Greek chicken soup thickened with eggs and lemon juice.
instructions: Bring chicken broth to a simmer in a pot.
Add orzo pasta or rice and cook according to package directions until tender.
Stir in shredded cooked chicken and heat through.
In a bowl, whisk eggs until light and frothy.
Gradually whisk in fresh lemon juice into the eggs.
Slowly ladle some of the hot broth into the egg-lemon mixture, whisking constantly to temper the eggs.
Pour the egg-lemon mixture back into the pot with the remaining broth, stirring constantly over low heat until the soup thickens slightly. Do not boil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh dill (if using) and serve warm.

name: Minestrone Soup
description: A hearty Italian vegetable soup with pasta.
ingredients: Canned kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, and celery and sauté until softened.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Stir in diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, oregano, and basil. Bring to a simmer.
Add diced potatoes, green beans, and zucchini. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in pasta and cook according to package directions.
Add rinsed kidney beans and heat through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.

name: Chickpea Spinach Stew
description: Nutritious stew with chickpeas, spinach, and aromatic spices.
instructions: Sauté onion and garlic.
Add chickpeas, tomatoes, and spices.
Simmer and add spinach until wilted.
Serve hot with lemon wedges.

name: Paneer Tikka
description: Indian-style grilled paneer cubes marinated in spices.
instructions: Mix yogurt with spices and lemon juice.
Marinate paneer cubes and refrigerate.
Grill or bake until charred.
Serve with mint chutney.

name: Tomato Basil Soup
description: A creamy and tangy soup made with fresh tomatoes and basil.
instructions: Sauté onion and garlic.
Add chopped tomatoes and broth.
Simmer and blend until smooth.
Add fresh basil and serve.

name: Zaatar Manakeesh
description: Flatbread topped with olive oil and zaatar spice mix.
instructions: Mix zaatar with olive oil.
Spread on flatbread.
Bake until golden and serve warm.

name: Pasta Primavera
description: Italian pasta tossed with colorful vegetables.
instructions: Cook pasta and set aside.
Sauté vegetables in olive oil with garlic.
Toss pasta with veggies and top with parmesan.
Serve warm.

name: Banana Oat Cookies
description: Healthy snack cookies made with bananas and oats.
instructions: Mash banana and mix with oats and cinnamon.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Shape into cookies and bake until golden.

name: Avocado Egg Toast
description: Toasted bread topped with mashed avocado and poached egg.
instructions: Toast bread and mash avocado with lemon juice.
Spread avocado on toast.
Top with poached egg and season.

name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp
description: Pan-seared shrimp with lemon and garlic sauce.
instructions: Heat oil and cook garlic.
Add shrimp and cook until pink.
Add lemon juice and parsley.
Serve hot with rice or salad.

name: Ginger Garlic Chicken
description: Chicken stir-fried with fresh ginger and garlic.
instructions: Sauté garlic and ginger.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Add soy sauce and green onions.
Cook until fully done.

name: Falafel Wrap
description: Crispy falafel balls wrapped in pita with veggies.
instructions: Warm the pita bread.
Add falafel, chopped veggies, and tahini.
Wrap and serve.

name: Vegetable Soba Noodles
description: Japanese soba noodles with stir-fried vegetables.
instructions: Boil soba noodles and set aside.
Stir-fry vegetables with ginger and sesame oil.
Add noodles and soy sauce, toss to combine.
Serve warm.

name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
description: Simple spaghetti with garlic, olive oil, and chili flakes.
instructions: Cook spaghetti and drain.
Sauté garlic and chili flakes in olive oil.
Toss pasta in oil and top with parsley.
Serve immediately.

name: Mujadara
description: Arabic dish of lentils and rice topped with caramelized onions.
instructions: Cook lentils and rice together with spices.
Caramelize onions separately.
Top lentil-rice mixture with onions.
Serve warm.

name: Sopa de Tortilla (Tortilla Soup)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet and fry tortilla strips until crispy. Drain on paper towels.
In a pot, heat chicken broth. Add chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened.
Stir in diced tomatoes and simmer for a few minutes.
Add shredded cooked chicken if using and heat through.
Ladle soup into bowls. Top with fried tortilla strips, shredded cheese, diced avocado, sour cream, and chopped cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Palak Paneer (Spinach and Cottage Cheese)
instructions: Blanch fresh spinach in boiling water for a minute, then transfer to ice water. Squeeze out excess water and puree. If using frozen spinach, thaw and squeeze out excess water.
Heat oil or ghee in a pan. Fry paneer cubes until lightly golden and set aside.
In the same pan, add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Stir in chopped tomato and cook until softened.
Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, and salt. Cook for a minute.
Stir in the spinach puree and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add the fried paneer cubes and garam masala. Simmer for a few minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and garnish with chopped cilantro before serving hot with roti or rice.

name: Wonton Soup
ingredients: Bok choy or other greens, chopped
instructions: In a bowl, combine ground pork or shrimp, soy sauce, sesame oil, chopped green onions, and grated ginger. Mix well.
Place a small amount of filling in the center of a wonton wrapper. Moisten the edges with water and fold into desired shape, sealing the edges.
Bring chicken broth to a boil in a pot.
Add the prepared wontons and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until they float to the surface and are cooked through.
Stir in chopped bok choy or other greens and cook until wilted.
Serve hot, garnished with more chopped green onions if desired.

name: Yakitori
description: Japanese grilled chicken skewers.
ingredients: Chicken thighs or breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a saucepan, combine soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and sake (if using). Bring to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened to make the tare sauce. Let cool.
Thread chicken pieces onto skewers.
Preheat grill or broiler to medium heat.
Grill or broil chicken skewers for 4-5 minutes per side, basting frequently with the tare sauce, until cooked through and nicely glazed.
Serve hot.

name: Greek Lemon Chicken and Potatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, toss chicken pieces and potato wedges with olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Arrange chicken and potatoes in a single layer in a baking dish.
Bake for 45-60 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender and golden brown, turning occasionally.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce and Caesar dressing. Toss to coat.
Add sliced grilled chicken, croutons, and shaved Parmesan cheese.
Toss gently and serve immediately.

name: Ful Medames
description: A traditional Egyptian dish of cooked fava beans served with vegetable oil, cumin, and optionally with chopped parsley, onion, garlic, and lemon juice.
instructions: Soak fava beans in water overnight.
Drain and rinse the soaked beans. Place them in a pot with fresh water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 hours, or until very tender.
Mash some of the beans to create a thicker consistency.
Stir in minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, cumin powder, and salt.
Serve warm, garnished with chopped parsley and onion if desired.

name: Horiatiki Salad (Greek Village Salad)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine quartered tomatoes, sliced cucumbers, thinly sliced red onion, and sliced green bell pepper.
Add Kalamata olives.
Place a block of feta cheese on top of the vegetables.
Sprinkle with dried oregano.
Drizzle generously with extra virgin olive oil and a splash of red wine vinegar if desired.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Do not toss until ready to serve.

name: Chicken Noodle Soup
instructions: In a large pot, bring chicken broth to a boil.
Add egg noodles and cook according to package directions.
Stir in sliced carrots, sliced celery, and chopped onion. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add minced garlic, shredded cooked chicken, bay leaf, and dried thyme. Season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for another 5-10 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Remove bay leaf before serving.

name: Tuna Salad Lettuce Cups
description: A low-carb tuna salad served in crisp lettuce cups.
instructions: Mix tuna, mayonnaise, diced celery, lemon juice, and pepper.
Scoop the mixture into lettuce leaves.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Sweet Potato Hash
description: Savory breakfast hash made with sweet potatoes and vegetables.
instructions: Dice sweet potatoes and cook in oil until tender.
Add chopped onion and bell pepper.
Cook until vegetables are soft and slightly browned.
Season and serve.

name: Stuffed Zucchini Boats
description: Zucchini halves filled with a savory meat and veggie mix.
instructions: Cut zucchinis in half and scoop out center.
Sauté ground beef with onion and garlic.
Mix in tomato sauce, fill zucchini boats.
Top with cheese and bake until tender.

name: Cucumber Mint Smoothie
description: Refreshing green smoothie with cucumber and mint.
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Serve immediately, chilled.

name: Poached Eggs on Spinach
description: Protein-rich breakfast of poached eggs over sautéed spinach.
instructions: Sauté spinach in olive oil.
Poach eggs in simmering water.
Place eggs on top of spinach and season.

name: Mango Chia Smoothie
description: Tropical smoothie blended with mango and chia seeds.
instructions: Soak chia seeds for 10 minutes.
Blend all ingredients until smooth.
Serve chilled.

name: Tofu Lettuce Wraps
description: Crispy tofu bits in Asian sauce served in lettuce cups.
instructions: Crumble and fry tofu until crispy.
Mix in sauce made with soy, garlic, and ginger.
Spoon mixture into lettuce cups and serve.

name: Spinach Mushroom Omelette
description: Wholesome omelette with spinach and sautéed mushrooms.
instructions: Sauté mushrooms and spinach in oil.
Beat eggs and pour into pan.
Cook until set and sprinkle cheese.
Fold and serve.

name: Grilled Halloumi Skewers
description: Grilled Mediterranean cheese and veggie skewers.
instructions: Cube cheese and vegetables.
Skewer and brush with olive oil and oregano.
Grill until golden and serve hot.

name: Coconut Yogurt Bowl
description: Dairy-free yogurt bowl with fruit and nuts.
instructions: Scoop yogurt into a bowl.
Top with fruit, nuts, and chia seeds.
Serve cold.

name: Cauliflower Rice Stir-Fry
description: Low-carb stir-fry made with cauliflower rice and veggies.
instructions: Pulse cauliflower into rice texture.
Sauté garlic and vegetables.
Add cauliflower rice and soy sauce.
Stir-fry for 5–7 minutes and serve.

name: Pesto Pasta Salad
description: Cold pasta salad tossed with basil pesto and veggies.
instructions: Cook and cool pasta.
Mix with pesto, tomatoes, olives, and feta.
Chill before serving.

name: Lentil Patties
description: Protein-packed patties made from lentils and herbs.
instructions: Mash cooked lentils and mix with other ingredients.
Form into patties and pan-fry until golden.
Serve hot with dip or salad.

name: Lasagna
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions.
Brown ground beef in a skillet. Drain excess fat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic and cook until softened.
Stir in tomato sauce, oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, and grated Parmesan cheese.
Layer lasagna noodles, meat sauce, ricotta mixture, and shredded mozzarella in a baking dish.
Repeat layers. Top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is melted and golden brown.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Enchiladas
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet and briefly fry corn tortillas to soften.
In a bowl, mix shredded chicken or beef with some shredded cheese and chopped onion.
Dip each softened tortilla in enchilada sauce.
Fill each tortilla with the meat and cheese mixture and roll up.
Place rolled enchiladas seam-down in a baking dish.
Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

name: Saag Paneer (Spinach with Indian Cheese)
instructions: Heat oil or ghee in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Stir in chopped tomato and cook until softened.
Add turmeric powder and salt. Cook for a minute.
Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted.
Stir in paneer cubes and garam masala. Simmer for a few minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
instructions: In a bowl, toss chicken cubes with cornstarch.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or skillet. Stir-fry chicken until browned and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, stir-fry bell peppers and onion until slightly tender.
Add pineapple chunks and stir-fry for a minute.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and ketchup.
Pour the sauce into the wok and bring to a simmer, stirring until slightly thickened.
Return the cooked chicken to the wok and toss to coat with the sauce.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

name: Ramen
ingredients: Pork belly or other protein, sliced
instructions: Cook ramen noodles according to package directions.
In a separate pot, heat pork or chicken broth.
Season broth with soy sauce and mirin. Add miso paste if desired.
Arrange cooked noodles in a bowl. Pour hot broth over the noodles.
Top with sliced pork belly, halved soft-boiled egg, sliced green onions, and nori seaweed.
Serve hot immediately.

name: Greek Lemon Rice
instructions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook until softened.
Add minced garlic and cook for a minute.
Stir in rice and cook for another minute until translucent.
Pour in chicken broth and lemon juice. Season with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed.
Fluff rice with a fork and stir in chopped fresh dill if desired. Serve hot.

name: Shepherd's Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brown ground lamb or beef in a skillet. Drain excess fat.
Add chopped onion and diced carrots and cook until softened.
Stir in tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, and dried thyme.
Pour in beef broth and bring to a simmer. Stir in frozen peas. Season with salt and pepper.
In a separate bowl, prepare mashed potatoes using butter, milk, salt, and pepper.
Transfer the meat mixture to a baking dish and spread mashed potatoes evenly over the top.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the topping is lightly golden and the filling is bubbly.

name: Chicken Shawarma
instructions: Cut chicken into thin strips. In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, cumin, coriander, turmeric, paprika, and salt. Add chicken and marinate for at least 2 hours.
Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Cook chicken until browned and cooked through.
Warm pita bread.
Assemble shawarma by filling pita bread with cooked chicken, tahini sauce, pickled vegetables, shredded lettuce, and sliced tomato.

name: Boeuf Bourguignon
description: A classic French beef stew braised in red wine.
instructions: Season beef cubes with salt and pepper. Dredge lightly in flour.
In a Dutch oven or large pot, cook bacon until crispy. Remove bacon and reserve fat.
Brown beef cubes in the bacon fat. Remove beef and set aside.
Sauté pearl onions and carrots in the pot until lightly browned.
Add minced garlic and cook for a minute.
Return beef and bacon to the pot. Sprinkle with flour and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomato paste. Pour in red wine and beef broth. Add thyme and bay leaf.
Bring to a simmer, then cover and braise in a preheated oven at 325°F (160°C) for 2-3 hours, or until beef is very tender.
Sauté sliced mushrooms in butter until browned. Add to the stew during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
Remove thyme sprigs and bay leaf before serving with mashed potatoes or crusty bread.

name: Pastitsio
description: A baked Greek pasta dish with ground meat and béchamel sauce.
instructions: Cook pasta until slightly underdone. Drain and toss with olive oil.
Brown ground meat in a skillet. Add chopped onion and minced garlic and cook until softened.
Stir in tomato sauce, cinnamon, allspice, red wine (if using), salt, and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes.

Melt butter in a saucepan. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in milk until smooth. Simmer until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in beaten eggs, half of the Parmesan cheese, and nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Layer half of the pasta in a baking dish. Spread the meat sauce over the pasta. Top with the remaining pasta and then the béchamel sauce.
Sprinkle with the remaining Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 45-60 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbly. Let rest before serving.
